page.title: 13DELPH LOCKS, BRIERLEY HILL
page.content: The{Delph Locks}rise from The Black Delph Bridge on the{Stourbridge Canal to join the{Dudley Canal}at The Nine } Locks Bridge. The flight of seven (originally nine)form an important local landmark, which rise 26.4m in approximately 500m.This gradient being almost 'alpine' by canal standards. The locks and canal were opened in conjunction with the expansion of heavy industry in the area at the end of the 18th century, the capital for the venture being raised by a group of local businessmen including the{Stuart family and other glass and steel producers. Between 1945-70 the canal fell into disrepair, gradually silting up and becoming overgrown.It has been greatly restored, but is now used purely for leisure.The main value of the locks to local residents is as an open space.
